title: Falla en la interfaz de su navegador
content: Después de descargar e instalar la actualización de su navegador, la interfaz de dicho navegador solo muestra letras tan pequeñas que ni son legibles, al igual que todo lo que se busca se ve igual, y también en todas partes de su navegador esta igual de ilegibles por las minúsculas letras, ni a configuraciones puedo acceder por que no se ve nada. Pos data, ADJUNTO UN ARCHIVO DE BÚSQUEDA QUE HICE EN SU NAVEGADOR, PARA COMPROBAR LO QUE HE REDACTADO
creator: resquin.alex468

title: opt-out the saved passwords proposals
content:
Hi,

is there a config option to prevent the showing of user/pw proposals when opening a website for which user account data is saved? When i'm logging into a website with already saved user data, i get account proposals (as ff saves the data "per domain", say if you have 3 accounts to one website, e.g. a test user, an administrator and a cms administrator, they are all presented where needed content may be...) see pict. I would like to opt out this behavior, as i have more than one website with 2 or more accounts.


-- cu

jth
creator: listen1

title: SSL_ERROR_UNKNOWN_CA_ALERT, but all CA certificates are be installed already and exceptions don't work
content:
I am on Linux Mint, Firefox 100.0 and I am trying to access a website, https://www.citapreviadnie.es:38188 (requires personal DNIe certificate). However, I keep getting SSL_ERROR_UNKNOWN_CA_ALERT. If I view the certificate of the website,

1. Firefox doesn't tell me which part of the chain is invalid or not trusted (or I don't see it) 2. When I try to download and import each of the CA certificates, I get an alert saying "This certificate is already installed as a certificate authority." 3. If I try to import the whole chain, I get another alert telling me "This is not a certificate authority certificate, so it can’t be imported into the certificate authority list." 4. If I try to add a permanent exception to the site, I see "This site attempts to identify itself with invalid information", but if I click "view certificate" I'm back to step 1, and adding the exception does not have any effect.

What am I supposed to do now?
creator: hello152

title: "Password required" popup blocks the entire Firefox app
content: Hi! Upgrading to version 100 has made Firefox completely unusable for me. Every time I open it, the "Password required" popup appears, which is normal. However, whether I enter my primary password or click "Cancel", the popup goes to the background and I cannot close it, nor click on anything in the app. In fact, I cannot even close the app except from the upper menu bar (I'm on OSX). See the attached screenshot to get an idea. Please help!!!
creator: dalle.c.guillaume

title: When I use Firefox, which was recommended by the website personnel, I get a giant clock picture on my screen and nothing else. I am trying to get on to "PGA.org"
content: 'I am on Firefox and then log into PGA.org, who recommended I use firefox for all my educational activities, a giant clock shows up when the educational portal should pop up. I have asked the PGA about it and they have no idea how to fix this.
creator: chris.treat3

title: Why is Firefox blocking almost every website?
content:
"Network Protocol Error" "Connection Failure" "You are not securely connect to this site."

It has almost become impossible to continue using this browser. Sadly, I had it as my primary browser for a long time and now I have to switch out everything and move to Chrome or something else.

Thank you for being so cautious and ramping your security features, but not to the extent that it just becomes unusable.

Do something!
creator: thomas.t.george

title: 32-bit Linux error: "undefined symbol: gdk_screen_get_monitor_scale_factor"
content:
Hi,

I used Firefox ESR on an old version of Puppy Linux (Slackware-based). It worked fine until about the end of November 2021, after which none of the updates worked. The last working version is 78.15.0esr (32-bit).

On any later version, if I run Firefox from a console I get the following error message:

firefox: symbol lookup error: /opt/firefox/libxul.so: undefined symbol: gdk_screen_get_monitor_scale_factor

About the same time this happened, Tor browser (based on Firefox ESR) also stopped working, giving a similar error message.

Could anyone explain to me why this happens and if/how I might be able to fix it?

Thanks.
creator: blip9
